required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Total-body PET/CT Imaging Using the uEXPLORER in Non-small Cell Lung Cancer Patients Treated by Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy Plus Nivolumab and Definitive Concurrent Chemoradiotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: Total-body PET/CT Imaging Using the uEXPLORER in Non-small Cell Lung Cancer Patients Treated by Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy Plus Nivolumab and Definitive Concurrent Chemoradiotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: The prospective study aims to explore the value of total-body PET/CT dynamic imaging (uExplorer) in assessing tumor metabolic heterogeneity and predicting prognosis for patients with locally advanced, unresectable non-small cell lung cancer (stage III) treated by neoadjuvant chemotherapy plus nivolumab and definitive concurrent chemoradiation therapy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From randomisation to 1 year after radiotherapy
primary_outcome.description: The dynamic change of tumor SUV examined by total-body PET/CT (uExplorer)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomisation to 1 year after radiotherapy
secondary_outcome.description: The dynamic change of tumor SUV examined by total-body PET/CT (uExplorer)

arm_group.description: Patients with locally advanced NSCLC will receive total-body PET/CT (uExplorer) scans before, during and after the treatment

intervention.description: A total-body positron emission tomography/computed tomography (PET/CT) scanner (uEXPLORER) with a 192-cm scan range was applied for cancer diagnosis, organ function assessment and treatment outcome prediction. The total-body PET scanner can acquire scans with lower administered activity or short acquisition time, total-body dynamic acquisition at a longer delayed time point, and high detectability of exiguous changes of the whole body, and tumor as well.

study_pop.textblock: Locally advanced non-small cell lung cancer patients treated by neoadjuvant chemotherapy plus nivolumab and definitive concurrent chemoradiation therapy
